column5: Just wondering if anyone has info on any ice in the Minden area; wondering specifically about Mountain, Horseshoe, 12 Mile and Boshkung?... Considering heading up there on Saturday either on foot or with the sled (depending on the conditions). Thanks  a lot for any info, Darcy

The bigger lakes just had a fresh 1-2 inches on them and some open water way out.. This was on tues.. couple smaller lakes had more... one i visited had 6 in one area and 2-3 in another with lots of slush
Thanks for the replies and PM's guys.
Fished Little Kash on Friday out from Kashaga lodge, Ice was 6" everywhere we went. Had the sleds out. Stayed away from the narrows though.

Drove back on hwy 35 Tuesday. Huts out close to shore on Grass Lk.  12 mile looked iced over apart from at the marina.  Mountain looked iced over apart from at the dam.  2 groups fishing on Mountain.  Gull Lake had open areas and no one out at Miners Bay.

Be very careful on 12 mile and on horseshoe lake they are dicey on a good year but guys are out and doing well on the smaller lakes most have 4-8 inches even up in the Dorset area I get first hand knowledge about this almost on a daily basis if I want to !!! The bro-inlaw is there everyday and all the lakes around that whole area !!! There was still lots of slush on the big lakes and not recomended yet but like I said use discretion and you will be ok on the smaller ones and they are getting some nice fish too !!!!
Came home today. Was very cold the last 3 days. Surprisingly there was about 10 guys on Boshkung. The Clansman had two huts close to shore. A few guys with portables. No one on Halls.
